MARITAL STATUS

Professions Actor , Producer , Co-producer more

Birth name Wagner Maniçoba de Moura

Nationality Brazilian

Birth June 27, 1976 (Rodelas, Bahia, Brazil)

BIOGRAPHY

After studying journalism, Wagner Moura finally decided to become an actor. He started at the theater in Salvador before landing a small role in 2001 in Broken April by Walter Salles . He then continued filming in his native country, quickly becoming a sure value in Brazilian cinema. He thus joins the cast of the noted Carandiru which retraces the events of the massacre which took place in the Sao Paulo prison in 1992. He also plays in Merchant on the Clouds by Vicente Amorim and in 2005, he plays a sailor caught in a complex triangle lovers in Sergio Machado ‘s multi-awarded feature film , Bahia, Lower Town .

2007 was an important year for the actor’s career. His participation in the telenovela “Paraiso Tropical” made him a real star in Brazil. He also shines in the theater in a new adaptation of Shakespeare’s “Macbeth”. But it was his role as a seasoned and determined cop in Elite Troop that made him known abroad. This dive into the corrupt world of the favelas quickly became number 1 at the Brazilian box office and won the Golden Bear at the 2008 Berlinale.

Wagner Moura reunited with director José Padilha two later to shoot the sequel to the film ( Elite Troop: The Enemy Within ) which met with the same success. In 2012, the actor changed register with the drama A Cadeira do pai and Neill Blomkamp ‘s American blockbuster , Elysium , in which he played the villain alongside Matt Damon and Jodie Foster . In 2016, the actor’s notoriety skyrocketed thanks to his feverish incarnation of the famous drug trafficker Pablo Escobar in the Netflix series Narcos .
